required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: TRUfill®'s Line in Intracranial aNeurysm Embolisation
clinical_study.official_title: A Prospective, Multicentric Observational Study Evaluating the Long Term Efficacy and Safety of the CODMAN TRUFILL®'s Line of Coils in the Endovascular Treatment of Intracranial Aneurysms

brief_summary.textblock: The objective of this study is to evaluate the long term efficacy and safety of the CODMAN TRUFILL®'s line of coils in the treatment of patients with intracranial ruptured or non-ruptured aneurysms in real-life routine clinical practice.

primary_outcome.measure: The long term safety of the coiling procedure with the CODMAN TRUFILL®'s line of coils will be assessed by the combined morbidity-mortality rate (CMMR) observed during the procedure and up to 1 year post-procedure follow-up.
primary_outcome.time_frame: Observed during the procedure and up to 1 year post-procedure follow-up

secondary_outcome.measure: The procedural CMMR observed during the procedure and up to 30 Days post procedure follow-up.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Observed during the procedure and up to 30 Days post procedure follow-up.

secondary_outcome.measure: The rate of permanent morbidity and mortality observed at 30 Days and at 1 year post-procedure follow-up, defined as a mRS of 3 to 6.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Observed at 30 Days and at 1 year post-procedure follow-up

secondary_outcome.measure: The rate of absence of deterioration or improvement of the neurological status observed at 30 days and at 1 year post procedure follow-up
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Observed at 30 days and at 1 year post procedure follow-up

secondary_outcome.measure: The overall rate of Adverse Event/Serious Adverse Event observed during the procedure, at 30 days and up to 1 year post-procedure follow-up
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Observed during the procedure, at 30 days and up to 1 year post-procedure follow-up

secondary_outcome.measure: The rate of Adverse Event/Serious Adverse Event related to the device and/or to the procedure observed during the procedure, at 30 days and up to 1 year post-procedure follow-up
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Observed during the procedure, at 30 days and up to 1 year post-procedure follow-up

secondary_outcome.measure: The rate of Unanticipated Adverse Device Effects observed during the procedure, at 30 days and up to 1 year post-procedure follow-up
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Observed during the procedure, at 30 days and up to 1 year post-procedure follow-up

secondary_outcome.measure: The rate of per-procedural subarachnoid hemorrhage of the treated aneurysm and rate of per-procedural SAH leading to a modification of the procedure initially planned
The rate of recurrent subarachnoid hemorrhage of the treated aneurysm at one-year post-procedure follow-up
The rate of aneurysm occlusion at the end of the procedure and at 1 year post-procedure follow-up
secondary_outcome.time_frame: End of the procedure and at 1 year post-procedure follow-up

secondary_outcome.measure: The rate of aneurysm recanalisation up to 1 year post-treatment defined as any increase in the size of the remnant or defined as a change of classification of the Raymond scale result related up to the 1 year post-procedure follow-up

The rate of spontaneous aneurysm regression up to 1 year post-treatment defined as any decrease in the size of the remnant or defined as a change of classification of the Raymond scale result related up to the 1 year post-procedure follow-up
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to the 1 year post-procedure follow-up

secondary_outcome.measure: The rate of retreatment at 1 year follow-up representing the rate of major recurrence on the target aneurysm observed up to the 1 year post-procedure follow-up
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to the 1 year post-procedure follow-up

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patient ≥ 18 years old
- Patient presenting one or more ruptured or non-ruptured intracranial aneurysms assessed by angiography
- Patient implanted with one or more CODMAN TRUFILL® coils
- Patient agree to take part in the study, or agreement of a representative of the patient in case of patient inability, after being informed by the investigator and have received information letter.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patient who does not accept to take part in the study after being informed
- Patient already enrolled in a clinical trial involving experimental medication or device.
